dcterms:description: The Test Of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL R) is an English speaking test used to evaluate students' basic English-speaking skills for use in academic institutions that use English as their primary teaching language. The dataset contains speech responses for a total of 24 test items, scored by human raters using a 4-point holistic scoring scale.
dcterms:title: Test Of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL R)
dcat:keyword: Test of English as a Foreign Language

dcterms:description: The dataset contains transcriptions of spoken responses obtained by running a state-of-the-art non-native ASR system, which uses a cross-word tri-phone acoustic model and n-gram language models trained on approximately 800 hours of spoken data.
dcterms:title: Non-native ASR system transcriptions
